qas.question: How did a receptionist describe the atmosphere after the evacuation?
How long were workers in Ford Plant evacuated for?
What happened to office buildings in Shanghai?
Why were flights delayed and diverted?
What were they using the airport to stage for?

context: Office buildings in <a0_0>Shanghai's financial district<a0_0/>, including the Jin Mao Tower and the Hong Kong New World Tower, were evacuated. A receptionist at the Tibet Hotel in Chengdu said things were "<a1_0>calm<a1_0/>" after the hotel <a5_0>evacuated<a5_0/> its guests. Meanwhile, workers at a Ford plant in Sichuan were evacuated for about <a2_0>10 minutes<a2_0/>. <a3_0><a6_0>Chengdu Shuangliu International Airport<a6_0/><a3_0/> was shut down, and the control tower and regional radar control evacuated. One SilkAir flight was diverted and landed in Kunming as a result. Cathay Pacific delayed both legs of its quadruple daily Hong Kong to London route due to this <a7_0>disruption in air traffic services<a7_0/>. Chengdu Shuangliu Airport reopened later on the evening of <a4_0>May 12<a4_0/>, offering limited service as the airport began to be used as a staging area for <a8_0>relief operations<a8_0/>.
